intro: Geranium asiaticum f. latilobum, commonly known as the broad-lobed geranium, is a cultivar of the geranium plant native to Asia. It is characterized by its broad, lobed leaves and clusters of pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and flowering display. This variety is well-suited for gardens and containers, requiring well-drained soil and regular watering.
